intro: Pentacalia phelpsiae, commonly known as the Phelps' pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and swampy areas. It has hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often clustered at the base. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
